title: Constant High Ping for Singapore Players
body: Since last Thursday, all of my friends in Singapore including me who play on Oceania server is experiencing super high ping like a constant 350-1.5k throughout the the whole game. Our usual ping is around 90-108 but something has caused this to happen which I believe is a hardware malfunction at the riot headquarter? All of us lives in different regions of Singapore using different network providers, hence it is definitely not our computer or network problem. Riot please fix this since none of us can play right now even though it is our School Break  {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}} Rito Please check on the System? Thanks alot!

replies.body:
Hey

The most likely reason for this is the recent cable cut on the SEA-ME-WE3 cable, which connects Singapore with Perth.   When it gets cut (happens from time to time), that traffic then has to find another route.  Usually via the USA, which increases latency dramatically.

The bad news is that current ETA for a fix is mid October at the earliest, since they have to [send a ship out there, find the break, pull it up off the ocean floor and then re-join it](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m6qTk5WNq9E).   The good news is that more cables are being built to service that route, but they aren't ready yet.

You can read more about the cut and ISPs involved here - https://www.itnews.com.au/news/aussie-internet-pain-after-asian-subsea-cables-cut-472070

Cheers
Mindstar

Thanks for the reply Mindstar, I was so confused as to what happened to my ping after I came back from travelling. 
Cheers for the update!
